page.title: 15Kildean Cattle Mart,Stirling
page.content: {Kildean Market}was built on farmland, in 1966, to replace the old market in {Seaforth Place.}This was to allow the construction of an internal relief road. The current value is Â£600,000. The market managers say Thursday is the busiest day. The market employs 60 people. There are{6 rings}which sell {sheep}costing{Â£20 to Â£60, pigs}costing {Â£30 to Â£80, dairy cows}costing{Â£350 to {Â£650}and{meat cows}costing{Â£300 to {Â£500.}Animals come from within a 100 mile radius and are checked by a vet for good health. As well as the animal market, the complex also houses a restaurant, petrol station{(Â£2.04 per {gallon),}car auction, car saleroom, fruit and vegetable market, two banks and various shops to cater for the specific needs of the farmer. The shop owners also confirmed that Thursday was certainly the busiest day.
